text:
Juri-chan, Juri-chan...!
Can I ask you a question...?

<line-height=80%><size=80%>The word where you put the thumb and index finger of your
right hand and left hand together, 'te' (手) and 'yubi' (指)...
── How do you read it?

Oh... I'm actually not sure which one it is...!
Is it "te yubi" or "yubi te"?

"To protect the fingers from dryness"...
── How about saying it altogether?

I see.
── Let's say it together.

Hahaha, no good...!
Guess it's not right, huh...? Maybe it's better to check on set?
